title: Ask HN: Chrome extension to summarize YT videos while browsing?
text:
I've worked at YouTube since 2020 and saw an explosion of viewers come onto the platform, but also an explosion of critiques and criticisms. The main gripes are that the algorithm serves poor recommendations, and that videos are too click-baity / filled with fluff (given the 10-min video length requirement for monetization).

Considering these issues, would anyone use a Chrome extension that would allow them to hover over a YT video thumbnail and see a summary of the video transcript? The user could then choose to either watch the video (based on the summary) or dislike it. This makes it easier to bulk dislike videos and tune your algorithm without investing several minutes to click a video, wait for the ads to be done, see the intro, then dislike, click back, and restart your browsing experience.

Ask HN: How do I rebuild myself and lead a life of success?
text:
All my life I’ve wanted to be an entrepreneur, but my battles with childhood trauma, depression, anxiety, and obesity have kept that dream out of reach.

I now find myself in my mid-30s totally stuck and hopeless. Despite therapy and medication, my physical and mental health have nearly hit rock bottom, and my aspirations seem to be drifting farther and farther away. I find it hard to focus, to plan, to process information, to think clearly. Motivation is nonexistent. On top of it all, I can’t father children. I just feel purposeless and eternally broken, an evolutionary dud.

By posting here, I guess I’m looking for encouragement, a sign that rebuilding at this age and achieving success is possible.
